cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles SSW of Tiburon, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest, cross central-western Cuba Monday, enter the Florida Straits, move northward up or just inland of Florida’s west coast and then track across south-central Georgia and the coastal Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend / Nature Coast near Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watches presently only Florida Keys west of Craig Key; none yet for Georgia coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Current warnings confined to Haiti, Jamaica and eastern/central Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeastern U.S. shoreline from the Florida Keys through coastal Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force gusts (40–50 mph) possible late 6–7 July
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge (1–2 ft) possible along Georgia barrier islands if onshore flow coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could drop 2–4 inches with local 4+ inches, causing ponding and harbor-side drainage delays
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands; short-period squalls affecting container and crane operations
